intro: Phycella phycelloides, commonly known as the common sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers and is native to the Mediterranean region. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to salty, well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Phycella phycelloides is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in harsh coastal environments.
